description: Can be use to download from Google Fonts

Easy to Install Fonts
Left hand side column mostly off screen. Looks nice and well thought out though.

the best app to add fonts to the system 
it recognize fonts that is from same family

I've been looking for a simple means of pruning the many fonts that I simply do not need. This 'Font Manager' seemed to fit my requirements. I first read the reviews here and at least three people stated that is was working well for them.

I'm using an almost clean installation of Ubuntu 18.04. I installed the 'Font Manager' in the usual way and then started it. I clicked 'Help' in order to get a feel of how this worked - but this showed a page that said 'Help' was not yet available!

I was able to list the 145 fonts on my system (most of which I do not need).
Clicking them 'unticked' them - and were then listed as 'disabled'. I then opened 'Only Office' and examined the available fonts. They were ALL still there. Okay! I rebooted the PC to see if that did the trick. No, it didn't. 

I won't bore you with the many options I tried, but since at least three people stated it worked for them I was extremely puzzled that I could not get it to work. I was sure that it was me not 'doing it right'. 

The website is listed on the download page so I went there to see if I could find any clue as to why I was having no success.

 I searched, and searched. Nothing. Finally, I noticed a user reporting a bug where Font Manager had locked his system. Out of curiosity I read further. I was absolutely SHOCKED at the response and brush-off he was give.
See for yourselves. https://github.com/FontManager/font-manager/issues/55 

I WILL NOT use any software from somebody who uses such profanity and calls a user a 'troll' because he had a problem, and states software versions offered are 'not his concern'.  The user was extremely polite. The 'Font Manager' coder/maintainer appears extremely 'entitled', pompous and rude.

Needless to say, although I'd like to know why I could not get Font Manager to work when clearly other users could, It will be uninstalled immediately.

If you read this far, thanks. 

Thisisi
summary: I Need to uninstall this. NOW!  Please read the reason

Very useful for uninstalling the reams of non-Latin fonts that Ubuntu installs by default; compatibility with foreign-language web content is great, but I'm an English speaker and the only fonts I want to use are Latin alphabet, and I need to declutter my font list.
I like the ability to browser and install fonts from Google Fonts
Why Gnome Team don't build an app like that? Gnome Fonts sucks.

Despite its claim of not being a "professional grade" font management app, as a graphic designer this is the kind of font manager I was looking for. Handier, more user-intuitive, and aesthetically more pleasant and cleaner than Fontmatrix, it shows your font by text or characters/glyphs, compares it along other fonts, organizes it by families/groups and, obviously, installs it.
It's great, but the Flatpak version doesn't work on Debian 11
A must have for my Gnome setup.
When installed as Flatpak Font Manager gave me lots of refresh issues and subtle errors on Ubuntu 20.04.3 None of these are present using the staging ppa.
summary: Works better when installed via ppa

description: This helped me when actual Fonts app behaved buggy.

Functions, smooth, no noticeable first use, got what I needed from first use very quickly. Easily got the app to look and feel the way I wanted almost right away. More apps need this traditional simplicity and stability
summary: Exactly what it says it is...

description: In OpenSUSE Tumbleweed. It does not load any of my fonts.

It worked right away. Easy to understand and use to install new fonts I copied from my other system and one I downloaded. I wish this came preinstalled in Gnome instead of the app called "Fonts", which is only for viewing.
Work as expected. I loads multiple fonts at once and works better than the default gnome font. I'm using fedora 37 with Gnome 43.
couldn't actually remove any fonts

Font on, font off. It has worked great for me for years, on various distros --- currently Kubuntu 23.04 (which has its own font management in the settings, but it developed a bug after a recent update, so I installed Font Manager to cover until the bug is fixed).

DO NOT USE THIS. I'm a graphic artist and had switched to linux a few months ago, thought I'd use this during a project to veiw my font but the program install all 9000 fonts I have to the system fonts and will not disable/remove more than 4000. It actually refuses to do so. I also can't select more than 1000 at a time to disable because again, it refuses to do that. I managed to timeshift to an earlier version of me OS to get rid of the problem, but it only half works, so now I get to reinstall. Thanks for $#%&ing me over Font Manager, and why the hell would you have an option to "import but not activate" fonts if you just activate all imported fonts anyway?
Does what it says
I was able to safely disable a huge list of unnecessary and foreign language fonts that were showing up on LibreOffice. Highly recommend this method !
I like it very much
